docs.snippet: The social network, blocked in China since 2009, has developed software to keep posts from appearing in users’ news feeds in specific geographic areas, current and former employees said.

headline.print_headline: For Facebook, Censorship Tool Could Reopen a Door to China
headline.main: Facebook Said to Create Censorship Tool to Get Back Into China

docs.snippet: It’s been a tough week for Mark Zuckerberg’s company. First it was fake news complaints; now it’s acknowledging bad user metrics. Neither is good.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Does Some Explaining on Metrics

docs.snippet: The group was started in late October by a 33-year-old woman. The book will maintain the random feel of scrolling through a Facebook feed.

headline.main: Book Deal for Pantsuit Nation, Facebook Page Supporting Hillary Clinton

docs.snippet: Facebook has had to issue several corrections about traffic numbers it gives to advertisers. Will marketers rebel?

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Why Facebook Can’t Count

docs.snippet: As the mainstream news media work to separate fact from fiction, Facebook — which has gobbled up much of the online ad market — must do its part.

headline.print_headline: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Step Up to Defend Truth
headline.main: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Defend the Truth

docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column maintains Facebook has special responsibility to take on role as defender of truth since social network has become major news source.

docs.snippet: In a Facebook post Friday, Mr. Zuckerberg said the company was considering third-party verification, better automated detection and simpler ways to flag suspicious content.

headline.print_headline: Facebook May Fight Fake News, Chief Says
headline.main: Facebook Considering Ways to Combat Fake News, Mark Zuckerberg Says

docs.snippet: On Friday afternoon, Facebook started telling users that their pages had been memorialized. Then things got awkward.

headline.main: Why Did Facebook Say I Was Dead?

docs.snippet: Trying to walk a careful line of neutrality, the social network announced measures to fight fake news on the site, including partnering with groups that can help fact-check articles.

headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Joins Fight Against Fake News

docs.snippet: The group’s stated goal is to express support for Hillary Clinton, but it has also served as a forum to discuss issues raised by Donald J. Trump’s rhetoric.

headline.main: Pantsuit Nation, a ‘Secret’ Facebook Hub, Celebrates Clinton

docs.snippet: Housing, employment and credit ads will no longer be able to use Facebook tools to exclude certain races. But other types of ads can still use them.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Limits Ads Targeted by Race
headline.main: Facebook Will Stop Some Ads From Targeting Users by Race
